channel.title: Gender - Digg
channel.description: Gender on Digg: the best articles, videos, tweets, and original content that the web is talking about right now

item.title: Hollywood Casts A Very Flattering Light On Right-Wing White Women
item.description: In reimagining the conservative activist Phyllis Schlafly as a prestige-TV antihero, the new FX series "Mrs. America" overlooks some uncomfortable realities.

item.title: Remembering The Time United Airlines Offered A Men-Only Flight
item.description: From 1953 through 1970, United offered men-only 'Executive flights' — something you might see on an episode of "Mad Men."

item.title: Silicon Valley's #MeToo Moment Didn't Change Anything
item.description: The missteps of tech culture, most women say, remains a discussion that doesn't easily traverse gender lines.
item.kicker: DISRUPTION FOR ME, NOT FOR THEE

item.title: Has Coronavirus Exposed A Horniness Gap Between Men And Women?
item.description: As COVID-19 takes up much of our mental energy, men and women are dealing with their sexual urges (or lack thereof) in different ways.

item.title: 'Never Rarely Sometimes Always': A Human Tale Of Reproductive Rights
item.description: Eliza Hittman's film explores how an alienated young person in difficult circumstances is kept from articulating her needs and desires by her naïveté and the cruel diktats of the world around her.

item.title: Why COVID-19 Is Different For Men And Women
item.description: COVID-19 has profoundly different outcomes for men and women - and not just in terms of their health. For a virus that infects people indiscriminately, why does gender have such an effect?
item.kicker: TWICE AS MANY MEN ARE DYING

item.title: 'The Woman In Michigan' Goes National
item.description: Governor Gretchen Whitmer is dealing with a historic pandemic, a bullying president and a big job tryout.

item.title: On Watching Boys Play Music
item.description: "With a drink in my hand and earplugs responsibly in place, I'm very aware that I've spent more than half my life essentially standing in the same spot: off to one side of the stage."

item.title: A Feminist Critique Of Murakami Novels, With Murakami Himself
item.description: "These women aren't just novelistic instruments for me. Each individual work calls for its own circumstances."
item.kicker: IS THIS SURREAL LIFE? IS THIS JUST FANTASY?

item.title: The G-Spot Doesn't Exist
item.description: Scientific experts have not been able to prove that the G-spot exists and is a source of sexual pleasure for women. The truth is the G-spot does not exist.

item.title: Welcome to the Age of Male Fertility Testing
item.description: With global fertility rates in decline, startups like Legacy and Dadi are helping men take a proactive approach to family planning.

item.title: Coronavirus Is A Weapon In An Increasingly Bizarre Gender War
item.description: MRAs, TERFs and second-wave feminists are obsessed with using the fact that the virus is more likely to kill men than women to prove even their most deranged points.

item.title: Coronavirus Is Killing More Men Than Women
item.description: Medical officials have some theories why coronavirus is killing more men than women, from habitual (smoking) to hormonal (estrogen).

item.title: A Men's Rights Attorney Explains How Defending Men In Divorce Cases Helped Her Understand The Importance Of Fatherhood
item.description: Marilyn York, a Men's Rights Family Law Attorney in Reno, Nevada, explains why she's passionate about defending fathers in court.
item.kicker: 'ADVOCATING FOR FATHERS ISN'T ABOUT DIMINISHING MOTHERS'

item.title: I'm Not Feeling Good At All
item.description: For many young women laboring under the grindstone of American capitalism, the operative feeling of the last ten or fifteen years has not been numbness, but suffering.

item.title: 1968: The Year That Haunts Hundreds Of Women
item.description: When Tran Thi Ngai was raped, she did not get justice, or even sympathy. She ended up in prison.
item.kicker: 'I DIDN'T WANT TO CARRY ON LIVING'

item.title: YouTube Sensation. Progressive In A Purple District. Single Mom
item.description: What the Democratic Party could learn from first-term Congresswoman Katie Porter.

item.title: How Games Marketing Invented Toxic Gamer Culture
item.description: How early marketing campaigns for online gaming platforms suggested toxicity isn't a bug, it's a feature.

item.title: Wonder Woman 1984 Director Patty Jenkins On Knowing When To Fight
item.description: The filmmaker walked away from Marvel and pushed to give Gal Gadot's superhero meaning: "You can't do movies you don't believe in."

item.title: Can The Outdoors Save Guys From Themselves?
item.description: Men suffer higher rates of depression, suicide, and drug abuse than women. Many are anxious and lonely — and, as a result, they're all too often angry and violent. Wilderness Collective thinks the solution lies in open spaces, UTVs, and fireside talks. But is that enough?

item.title: The Wing Is A Women's Utopia. Unless You Work There
item.description: The social club's employees have a story to tell about the company that sold the world Instagram-ready feminism.

item.title: When 'The Woman Pledge' Is A Red Herring
item.description: Joe Biden's commitment to choosing a female running mate as VP made headlines, but what does it really mean when you look at his record and at his current policy proposals?

item.title: The Women Who Defied Boko Haram And Survived
item.description: Hundreds of women in Nigeria have been recruited by Boko Haram as suicide bombers, but some managed to outsmart the terrorist group. This is one woman's story.

item.title: Why Gender Stereotypes Are Perpetuated On Instagram
item.description: Ruddy-cheeked children? The perfect home? For women influencers, that's where the money is

item.title: When Your Barber Assumes You're A Racist Too
item.description: Being a spectator at the men's evil bullshit parade every time I sat down for a haircut sucked. What was worse, maybe, was that my silence implicated me every time. And I let it.

item.title: The Push To Get More Girls On Bikes
item.description: Like many outdoor sports, cycling struggles with gender equality. In Colorado, a handful of youth organizations are trying to change that.
item.kicker: MORE ROLE MODELS AND MENTORS ARE HERE

item.title: What It's Like To Be A Leftover Woman
item.description: From China's "leftover women" to Israel's "baby machines," society still dictates female lives.

item.title: The Storykiller And His Sentence: Rebecca Solnit On Harvey Weinstein
item.description: "To be a woman is to be forever vigilant against violence."

item.title: I Swapped Chores With My Husband To Learn Why Women Do 12 More Days Of Housework Every Year
item.description: The chore gap between the genders is widening, so Sophie Morris switched roles with her husband to see how it would affect their lives.

item.title: What The Invisible Man Gets Right About Women In Horror
item.description: This adaptation of "The Invisible Man" joins 2000's "Hollow Man" in making its female characters the ones that count.

item.title: Roberta Williams Is The World's First Graphic Computer Game Designer — But She's Famous For All The Wrong Reasons
item.description: "Video game history doesn't know how to make sense of her except to single her out."

item.title: For Women, Moderate Exercise Might Be Best
item.description: Women need to exercise for longer periods at a lower intensity in order to boost metabolism and optimize aerobic fitness.

item.title: Testosterone Is Widely, And Sometimes Wildly, Misunderstood
item.description: Testosterone has a big, popular reputation for causing all sorts of things, but what science tells us is quite different.

item.title: Investigating The 'Sexy Baby Voice' Phenomenon
item.description: "Love Is Blind" contestant Jessica's affected tone of voice when speaking to men got people talking. Experts weigh in on the common behavior.
item.kicker: BENJAMIN BUTTON BUT FOR THE VOICE

item.title: What We Get Wrong About Misogyny
item.description: Sexism and misogyny are not the same — and the difference matters.

item.title: The Motorcycle Woman Of Pakistan
item.description: Thought to be the first Pakistani woman to ride across Pakistan, Irfan runs the blog "1 Girl 2 Wheels."

item.title: The Horrifying Reason Women Are Searching For Their Own Cities On Pornhub
item.description: It's not because they want local smut — it's because they're chasing down revenge porn that the tube site is unable to curb.

item.title: Begin Modeling: How A University Of Oregon Freshman Was Coerced Into Sex Trafficking
item.description: To Kelly Lanzafame, this wasn't just two grand and a free trip to San Diego; it was a chance to keep her housing.

item.title: We're In The Middle Of A Sports Bra Revolution
item.description: Technological advances and a growing line of research have paved the way for a new class of support systems that are comfortable, look good, and fit a wide(r) variety of bodies.

item.title: With Warren, The Dream Of A Female President Dies Again
item.description: Hopes were high last year, with so many well-qualified female candidates. Now we're down to one, and she's on her way out. What happened?

item.title: Do Women Like Funny Guys?
item.description: Those aren't jokes they hear, it's an all-too-needy cry for help.

item.title: 100 Women Of The Year
item.description: From Amelia Earhart to Beyoncé and Eva Perón to Malala, meet 100 women who defined the last century.

item.title: Women's Unpaid Labor Is Worth $10,900,000,000,000
item.description: If American women earned minimum wage for the unpaid work they do around the house and caring for relatives, they would have made $1.5 trillion last year.

item.title: 'Portrait Of A Lady On Fire' Is More Than A 'Manifesto On The Female Gaze'
item.description: Céline Sciamma builds her finespun romance out of glances and stares, while also thoroughly exploring the entanglements between artistic creation and burgeoning love.

item.title: The Unsung Photographer Of The 20th Century
item.description: Uncelebrated for most of her life, Ida Wyman spent decades amassing an extraordinary archive of street photography.

item.title: Pornhub To Release First Ever Non-Adult Film, About Black Lesbian Strip Club Culture
item.description: Pornhub will stream the documentary "Shakedown," about LA's black, queer strip club scene from director Leilah Weinraub.

item.title: The Supreme Court Case That Could Transform Abortion In America
item.description: June Medical Services v. Russo could force patients to go to court to fight for an abortion.

item.title: The Best $20 I Ever Spent: A 'Man-Purse'
item.description: As a guy, I hadn't given much thought to what I did (and didn't) carry around with me, until my partner opened my eyes.

item.title: Women Explain Things To Me
item.description: In her new book "The Power Notebooks," Katie Roiphe puts forward a kind of Trojan horse feminism, which empowers women to keep men empowered.

item.title: If Miscarriage Is So Normal, Why Doesn't Anybody Talk About It?
item.description: When she loses a pregnancy, Anna Lea Hand searches in vain for vital advice and information.
